content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of MDMA.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    CHEMICALS

mdma



Spiral Erowid Zip Hoodie

This black mid-weight zip hoodie (80/20) has front pockets, an Erowid logo on front chest, and a spiral design on back.

Donate and receive yours!

NAME : MDMA CHEMICAL NAME : 3,4-methylenedioxymethamphetamine ALTERNATE CHEMICAL NAMES : 3,4-methylenedioxy-n-methylamphetamine; N, alpha-Dimethyl-1,3-benzodioxole-5-ethanamine; methylenedioxy-n-methylamphetamine; N-methyl-3,4-methylenedioxyphenylisopropylamine; Ecstasy; E; XTC; Adam CHEMICAL FORMULA C 11 H 15 NO 2 MOLECULAR WEIGHT 193.25 MELTING POINT 147-148° C (Hydrochloride crystals from isopropanol/n-hexane) MELTING POINT 152-153° C (Hydrochloride crystals from isopropanol/ether) LD 50 (mice) 97 mg/kg i.p. LD 50 (rats) 49 mg/kg i.p. LD 50 (guinea pigs) 98 mg/kg i.p. From the Merck Index 12th Edition

MDMA Molecule

MDMA Material Safety Data Sheet (Radian)

Local File

Local File

PubChem : MDMA


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed chemical information on MDMA, including its chemical name, alternative names, formula, molecular weight, melting points, toxicity data, and reference sources. It is part of the larger "Chemicals" subsection on the webpage, offering specific data relevant to substance identification and safety within the comprehensive Erowid database.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Chemistry
metadata.description: Information and images about the chemistry of MDMA.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of MDMA.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    5806. MDMA. N, alpha-Dimethyl-1,3-benzodioxole-5-ethanamine; 3,4-methylenedioxymethamphetamine; N-methyl-3,4-methylenedioxyphenylisopropylamine; "Ecstasy"; "E"; "XTC"; "Adam". CHNO; mol wt 193.25. C 68.37%, H 7.82%, N 7.25%, O 16.56%. Entactogen; N-methyl derivative of MDA, q.v. (S)-Form possesses more potent CNS activity. Prepn: Ger. pat. 274,350 (1914 to E. Merck), C.A. 8, 3350 (1914); U. Braun et al., J. Pharm.Sci. 69, 192 (1980). Spectral and chromatographic analyses: K. Bailey et al., J. Assoc. Offic. Anal. Chem. 58, 62 (1975). GC/MS determn in urine: B.K. Gan et al., J. Forensic Sci. 36, 1331 (1991). HPLC determn in whole blood: R. E. Michel et al., J. Neurosci. Methods 50, 61 (1993). Acute toxicity study: H. F. Hardman et al., Toxicol. Appl. Pharmacol. 25, 199 (1973). Series of articles on history, pharmacology, and neurotoxicity: : Ann. N.Y. Acad. Sci. 600, 601-715 (1990). Review of biochemical actions: M. Rattray, Essays Biochem. 26, 77-87 (1991); of pharmacology, toxicology,


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides a detailed chemical profile of MDMA, including its synonyms, molecular formula, weight, physical properties, synthesis history, analytical methods, toxicity data, and references. It is situated within the Chemicals section of the web page, serving as a comprehensive scientific overview relevant for research, identification, and legal considerations related to MDMA.

Rattray, Essays Biochem. 26, 77-87 (1991); of pharmacology, toxicology, and human experience: T.D. Steele et al., Addictions 89, 539-551 (1994); A.R. Green et al., Psychopharmacology 119, 247-260 (1995).


                    Context: 
                    This chunk references scientific literature on MDMA's history, pharmacology, and neurotoxicity, citing key reviews and studies that analyze its biochemical actions, toxicology, and human effects. It enhances the document's research value by providing authoritative sources for understanding MDMA's scientific background, making it relevant for users seeking in-depth technical information.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Chemistry
metadata.description: Information and images about the chemistry of MDMA.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of MDMA.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    2D MDMA MOLECULE

Oil, bp 100-110degrees Hydrocholoride, CHNO.HCl, crystals from isopopanol/n-hexane, mp 147-148° (Bailey). Crystals from isopropanol/ether, mp 152-153° (Braun). uv max (ethanol): 286 nm (E 2843). LD in mice, rats, guinea pigs (mg/gk): 97,49,98 i.p. (Hardman). Note: This is a controlled substance (hallucinogen) listed in the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations, Title 21 Part 1308.11 (1995).

                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed chemical information about MDMA in its 2D molecular form, including physical properties like boiling point, melting point, UV absorption, and toxicity data, within the broader Erowid Chemicals section on illicit substances. It is part of the drug-specific data on the MDMA page, aiding research and reference on the substance's chemical profile and legal status.
